data.title: Imagining Other Worlds at the India-Pakistan Border
data.excerpt: For decades, soldiers at the border between Attari, India, and Wagah, Pakistan, have staged an elaborate ceremony for onlookers. An anthropologist reflects on the ceremony as a legacy of Partition—and imagines other futures for the two nations.

data.title: The Best Ways to Use Mirrors in Your Home
data.excerpt: Suggestions from design pros on where to find mirrors and where to put them to get the most sparkle.

data.title: A Beginner’s Guide to Luxury Cruises

data.title: Will a Uniform Civil Code end Indian ‘secularism’?
data.excerpt: Indian PM Narendra Modi says common personal laws will help women, but many fear the proposal is a political weapon to portray Muslims and other religious minorities as regressive.

data.title: How Inclusive Is India Inc.?
data.excerpt: Companies have the intent to hire people with varied sexual orientations, physical disabilities, and neuro diversities. However, only the top firms are walking the talk.

data.title: How COVID-19 Changes the Immune System
data.excerpt: If the COVID-19 pandemic has done one thing, it’s made us all more familiar with some of the important players in the immune system.

data.title: I Feel Like My Friendships Are Becoming More Transactional

data.title: For ancient Romans, India existed in a liminal zone between the marketplace and the imagination

data.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Your Stress Levels
data.excerpt: Stress is a part of life, and eliminating it is a fool’s errand. If you ever succeeded in eliminating all of stress, your life would be boring and you’d have removed yourself from anything meaningful. That said … too much stress can be toxic.

data.title: Putin’s Deadly Revenge on Prigozhin

data.title: ‘They thought they were immortal’: the rise and fall of San Francisco’s 60s music scene
data.excerpt: Enough time has passed for the scene in 60s San Francisco to turn from memory to history, now understood predominantly as a set of ideas and signifiers: flower power, free love, fringe vests, infrequent showers, idealistic good vibes giving way to an inevitable comedown.

data.title: Why this British photographer has spent a decade dressing like Dolly Parton
data.excerpt: Alice Hawkins has never photographed her idol, Dolly Parton, but she has photographed many Dollys. Her book “Dear Dolly” is a love letter to the country superstar and to the sisterhoods formed in her name.

data.title: Florida’s War With Invasive Pythons Has a New Twist
data.excerpt: It may not be possible to eradicate the state’s tens of thousands of Burmese pythons. But the local wildlife is biting back—and humans wielding new tech can help.

data.title: What I Wish My Dad Taught Me When I Was Little, According To 11 Men
data.excerpt: It’s impossible to teach everything. But it’s helpful to know what untaught lessons might be felt the most.
